edu.wmich.cs3310.MPeter.hw5

Class UserInput

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.wmich.cs3310.MPeter.hw5.UserInput

  • public class UserInput
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains methods that do all necessary generation of data, collection of information from the user, and printing of information to the console.
    Author:
    Matthew Peter

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void generateFile()
      This method collects the name of and number of records in a binary file that is then generated for the user.
      char mainMenu()
      This method prints the main menu and collects the selection made by the user.
      void resizeBufferPool()
      This method allows you the change the number of buffers that are used in the buffer pool.
      void sortFile(java.io.FileWriter fw)
      This method collect the name of a binary file from the user that is then sorted using QuickSort objects and prints statistics relating to the process to a text file.

    • Method Detail

      • mainMenu

        public char mainMenu()
        This method prints the main menu and collects the selection made by the user. It also checks to make sure that the selection is valid.
        Returns:
        Menu selection made by user

      • generateFile

        public void generateFile()
                  throws java.io.IOException
        This method collects the name of and number of records in a binary file that is then generated for the user.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Handles Input/Output Exceptions

      • sortFile

        public void sortFile(java.io.FileWriter fw)
              throws java.io.IOException
        This method collect the name of a binary file from the user that is then sorted using QuickSort objects and prints statistics relating to the process to a text file.
        Parameters:
        fw - FileWriter object that will be used to write statistics to a text file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Handles Input/Output Exceptions

      • resizeBufferPool

        public void resizeBufferPool()
        This method allows you the change the number of buffers that are used in the buffer pool.
